title: CSE-Department Administration - NSRIT
content:
Search for: CSE-Department Administration NSRIT > Computer Science & Engineering > CSE-Department Administration Department Profile About the Department CSE-Magazines Faculty Faculty List Faculty Participations & Achievements Student’s Corner Roll of Honour Academic Toppers Academic Projects Skill Oriented Courses Professional Societies – Activities Co-Curricular Activities Technical Club Extra Curricular Activities Placements Laboratories Program Specific Lab Details Industry Supported Laboratories Department Administration Research Publications Projects & Consultancy CSE-Startups Industrial Intraction Department MOUs CSE Internships Industrial Visits Learning Resources CSE-Materials CSE-Self Reflection Videos CSE-Alumni Department Gallery Contact Us Department Administration DEPARTMENT RESEARCH COMMITTEE (DRC): Responsibilities: Identify thrust areas and specific topics on which to work further. Identify the faculty who would be working on those areas. Decide if the same can be applied for funding or to request management for funding. Identify funding agencies, forward applications and maintain records. Draw action plan for implementation and monitor the same. The committee shall meet twice in a semester. Committee Members Dr R. Srinivas, Professor & HOD (Chairperson) Dr V.Sreeram Murthy, Professor Dr D. Sirisha, Professor Dr K.Madhavi, Professor Dr R. Priya Vaijayanthi, Professor Dr T. V. S. Sriram, Associate Professor Mr K. Shankar, Associate Professor PROGRAM ACADEMIC & ASSESSMENT COMMITTEE (PAAC): Responsibilities: The committee shall monitor the academic related activities and monitor the continuous quality improvement initiatives in enriching the attainment of COs, POs and PSOs. Also to suggest timely and suitable amendments through the meeting and the proceeding of the meeting may be sent to the DAB for ratification. The committee roles and responsibilities are as follows Monitor the academic activities of the department to ensure quality teaching, learning, and continuous improvement initiatives are effectively implemented. Engage in continuous quality improvement by proposing timely actions to bridge curriculum gaps. Provide the necessary inputs during the design of the curriculum by module coordinators and faculty. Engage with all stakeholders (students, faculty, industry, employer, alumni, etc.) to gather input and make informed recommendations for improving POs, PSOs. Promote active participation of faculty and students with external communities through the organization or attendance of seminars, workshops, and conferences through the head of the department. Encourage the development of projects, working models, and engagement in research to cultivate a culture of lifelong learning and innovation. Committee Members Dr R. Srinivas, Professor & HOD (Chairperson) Mr. K. Shankar,Assistant Professor (Programme Coordinator) Module Coordinators : Dr. V. Sree Rama Murthy -Programming and Development Dr.K.Madhavi – Theoretical Foundation and Mathematics Dr.T. V. S.Sriram -Database Management Dr. S. Sarojini Devi-Computer Architecture and Systems Ms.G. Aparanjini-Networking and Communication CURRICULAM DELIVERY MONITORING COMMITTEE Responsibilities: Monitor course delivery and syllabus completion. Recommend curriculum updates aligning with industry trends and OBE principles. Collect and review course outcomes (COs) mapping and attainment data. Submit quarterly curriculum monitoring reports to IQAC and BoS. Coordinate with examination cell to ensure evaluation aligns with outcomes. Committee Members Chairperson: Dr. R. Srinivas – Professor & HOD Coordinator: Mr. Suryanarayana – IQAC Coordinator (Assistant Professor) Class Teacher Representatives: Mrs. L.Jyothi – II Year (Assistant Professor) Mr. A. Suraj Kumar – III Year (Assistant Professor) Mrs. L.T. Priyanka – IV Year (Assistant Professor) Faculty Representatives: Dr. K. Madhavi – Professor Dr. S. Sarojini Devi – Associate Professor Mr. K. Shankar – Associate Professor Mrs. S. Jaya Prada – Assistant Professor Mrs. M. Bhargavi – Assistant Professor DEPARTMENT LIBRARY COMMITTEE (DLC): Responsibilities: Prepare a list of books of relevance and also of Journals/magazines with price for getting them to Library. Obtain necessary approval and plan for procurement. Intimate students/staff regarding availability and new arrivals on regular basis. Maintain accession register and issue register. The committee shall meet twice in a semester. Committee Members Dr R. Srinivas, Professor & HOD (Chairperson) Mrs L.T. Priyanka, Assistant Professor Mrs Ch. Devi, Assistant Professor Mrs D.Aparna, Assistant Professor Mr Y. Suresh Gopi, Assistant Professor DEPARTMENT BUDGET COMMITTEE (DBC): Responsibilities: Get budget for academic year wise and consolidate for submission to accounts. Monitor use of funds and ensure records are maintained both at the lab and office department. Solicit and scrutinize budget for seminars/guest lectures etc., from the organizing faculty before finalizing and keep a record of the same in department. For any additional unexpected resource requirements, plan for getting approval. Discuss and take action for sanction of any additional resource not envisaged in the budget if need arises. The committee shall meet Monthly once. Committee Members Dr R. Srinivas, Professor & HOD (Chairperson) Dr K.Madhavi, Professor Mr K.Shankar, Associate Professor Mr P. Chandra Mohan , System admin Mr T. Siva Smaran, System admin DEPARTMENT PROJECT REVIEW COMMITTEE (DPRC): Responsibilities: Finalize student groups and topics in IV year I Semester. Review and approve the projects Monitor the progress with student groups three times during the duration of project. Approving project submission. Internal evaluation at the end of the project. Identify best projects. Submit copies of project reports to library. Collect titles and synopsis from faculty and ensure entry of these in Project Compendium. Ensure entry of best projects in Project Arcade. The committee shall meet twice in a semester. Committee Members Dr R. Srinivas, Professor & HOD (Chairperson) Dr V. Srirama murthy, Professor Dr T.V.S.Sri Ram, Associate Professor Dr C.S Manikandan, Associate Professor Mr K.Shankar, Associate Professor Mr A. Nagabhushan Rao, Assistant Professor Mrs, M. Bhargavi, Assistant Professor Mrs S. Jayapada, Sr. Assistant Professor DEPARTMENT ADVISORY BOARD Responsibilities: Periodically evaluating the attainment of POs and PSOs, identifying areas for improvement. Assess the effectiveness of the program and recommend necessary improvements to ensure continuous quality enhancement. Identify and propose actions to address curriculum gaps, ensuring the effective achievement of POs and PSOs. Interact with the stakeholders through HOD to facilitate the achievement of POs, PSOs, and PEOs Committee Members Dr R. Srinivas, Professor & HOD (Chairperson) Mr. K. Shankar,Assistant Professor (Programme Coordinator) Module Coordinators : Dr. V. Sree Rama Murthy -Programming and Development Dr.K.Madhavi – Theoretical Foundation and Mathematics Dr.T. V. S.Sriram -Database Management Dr. S. Sarojini Devi-Computer Architecture and Systems Ms.G. Aparanjini-Networking and Communication Faculty Representative : Mrs. S. Jaya prada Academician: Dr. T. V. Madhusudhana Rao,Professor & HOD
            Vignan’s Institute of Information Technology
            Visakhapatnam Industry Representation: Sri. Sai Satish,CEO, Indian Servers Sri G. Avinash,CEO, DSS, Visakhapatnam Alumni Representation  : Ms.G.Jyothi Ms. D. Sushma Parent : Sri. T. Sankara Rao Student : Mr. Ch. Hari Kiran BOARD OF STUDIES Responsibilities Monitoring the achievements of Program Outcomes (POs), Program Specific Outcomes (PSOs) and Program Educational Objectives (PEOs), Course Outcomes(COs) and proposes necessary changes for the attainment of PEOs and POs. Assessment data would be gathered and reported as per assessment cycle. The committee will create an assessment cycle to ensure that all POs, PSOs are being assessed in a reasonable time period. Review submitted assessment plans and reports and recommend revisions as appropriate. Verify that assessment results have been used for programmatic improvements (close the loop). To remain update about current and knowledgeable assessment tools, practices and guidelines. Interact with students, faculty and other stakeholders in facilitating PEOs. Track status and report of work assigned to individual & bring out in notice to DAC. The committee shall meet twice in a semester. Committee Members Dr R. Srinivas, Professor & HOD (Chairperson) Dr. R.Rajeswara Rao, Director of Academic Audit & Professor, Dept. of CSE, University College of Engineering Vizianagaram, JNTUGV (University) Dr. Ch.Sudhakar, Professor, Dept. of CSE, NIT Warangal (Academia) Dr. Valli Kumari Vatsavayi, Professor, Dept. of CSSE, Andhra University Mr. V. S. S. Vijay Kumar Prayagala , Capgemini, Managing Consultant, Netherlands B.V. Mr. Akil Kakarlapudi, Sr. Software Engineer, Tech Mahindra (Alumni)Dr R. Srinivas, Professor & HOD (Chairperson). DEPARTMENT EXAMINATION COMMITTEE Responsibilities: All members are requested to strictly follow examination protocols, maintain confidentiality, and ensure timely submission of evaluation reports. Committee Members Coordinator: Mrs. Vahini, Assistant Professor Members: Dr. C.S. Manikandan – Associate Professor Mrs. K. Sudheeshna – Assistant Professor Mrs. J. Santoshi Kumari – Assistant Professor Mr. A. Suraj Kumar – Assistant Professor Mrs. M. Bhargavi – Assistant Professor Mrs. G. Aparanjini – Assistant Professor DEPARTMENT MENTORING COMMITTEE Responsibilities: Members are instructed to conduct regular classroom monitoring, review lesson plans, and collect data on curriculum implementation for IQAC documentation. Committee Members Dr. S. Sarojini Devi – Associate Professor Dr. C.S. Manikandan – Associate Professor Mrs. K. Sudheeshna – Assistant Professor Mr. A. Suraj Kumar – Assistant Professor Mrs. G. Aparanjini – Assistant Professor Mrs. J. Santoshi Kumari – Assistant Professor Mr. A. Nagabhushana Rao – Assistant Professor ×
